fields.title: Chapter 27 - Down to the Grind
fields.content: Heartbreakerâs White Shirt |Type|Shirt|Rank|Common A simple white shirt, that can be found anywhere. This one has been altered by a tailor to conform to the wearerâs body better, and enchanted to make them appear more desireable.Â +5% to SeductionEnchanted: +5 CHA Charmerâs Charmed Pants |Type|Pants|Rank|Common A simple pair of pants, the like of which can be found anywhere. This pair has been altered to better show off the goods, and enchanted to resist othersâ charms.Â +5% to SeductionEnchanted: +5% Charm Resistance Robes of Dark Flame |Type|Pants|Rank|Common A robe worn by a Flame Sorceress, but taken from her after her defeat. This robe has been altered by a Tailor to better fit one on the darker paths of magic.Requires Level 10Requires Evil AlignmentÂ +15% Light Resistance+15% to Dark Spells+15% to Fire SpellsEnchanted: +10 INT Lierin SyldiElf FemaleLevel 16 Flame SorceressGuild: Scions of TorganTitles: Marked for Death Kharis GregwynElf MaleLevel 23 FighterTitles: Thug Glorandal JofirElf MaleLevel 23 RogueTitles: Thug Kellam TheyraElf MaleLevel 20 Fighter, PriestGuild: Scions of TorganTitles: Inquisitor, Marked for Death Malon UmeronaDark Elf FemaleLevel 20 Priestess, RogueGuild: Scions of TorganTitles: Inquisitor, Marked for Death Arlayna DaericHalf-Celestial Elf FemaleLevel 20 Barbarian, FighterGuild: Scions of TorganTitles: Inquisitor, Marked for Death New Title Unlocked!Â Trophy HunterYou take trophies from your kills, to remember them by. All creatures of the same type who see you take a trophy suffer a -20% morale debuff on all actions for 30s. Creatures 10 levels below yours gain the Fear condition when you take a trophy of the same type as they are.Â Trophies taken from Travelers remain lost when the Traveler resurrects, unless it is critical for survival (such as a heart, or head), forcing them to play with a permanent debuff unless they can have a high level healer regrow the part for them. Critical trophies (such as a heart, or head) either delay the Travelerâs resurrection until the lost part is recovered by their friends, a high level healer âhealsâ the body prior to resurrection, or the Traveler changes to an Undead race.Â +420 InfamyCelestial Wings Trophy ---

fields.title: Chapter 25 - Meeting the King
fields.content: Avourel Liarora High Elf Male Level 200 Paladin (Lightbearer), Fighter (Weaponmaster) Titles: King of the Wyrmwood, Defender of the Realm, Lord of Light, Faithful of the Elf-Father, Protector of the Innocent, Undead Bane, Demonbane Vanya Carcan Liarora Winged Elf Female Level 200 Sorceress (Mindbender), Rogue (Assassin) Titles: Queen of the Wyrmwood, Bane of Kilfall, Mystic Blade, Pleasant Death, Keeper of Secrets Status Upgrade! Â  Your status has changed from âTravelerâ to âKnightâ! As a Knight, you are allowed to freely carry weapons in most lands, and may receive priority quests. Your reputation with NPCs favorable to Wyrmwood increases. Your reputation with NPCs antagonistic to Wyrmwood decreases. You have the right to be called âSirâ, and are considered minor nobility. You are expected to be loyal to the Wyrmwood. Â  +210 Fame (Raised from 200) World First! Â  Zayn Darkmore is the first Traveler to rise to the nobility. Sir Zayn Darkmore is now a Knight of the Wyrmwood, and a representative of that kingdom. Guild War! Â  Because they declared war upon the player Zayn Darkmore and his allies, the Scions of Torgan guild is now at war with the Wyrmwood, and considered kill on sight within their borders. All players who kill a member of the Scions of Torgan within the Wyrmwood gain 100 Fame, and do not gain Infamy for the deed.

fields.title: Chapter 45 - Demon's Duel
fields.content: Zayn Darkmore has challenged Kali Dorna to the Demonâs Duel! As Challenger Zayn has paid 1000 GP as required by the terms and conditions of the EULA, this challenge may not be refused. Both players may decide on the death penalty for their opponent should they prove victorious. The death penalty may be anything, up to and including character deletion. Death penalties may not affect your opponentâs Struggle.net account or reveal any financial or personal information about the player. Attempts to do so will result in a permanent ban from all Icestorm products. Â  Enter your opponentâs death penalty now: Processing death penaltiesâ¦ Â  Both players have selected allowable death penalties, as per the EULA. ATTENTION! Â  A Demonâs Duel has been declared by Zayn Darkmore, challenging Kali Dorna. This duel will be to the death. There is no restriction on spells or abilities. No other creatures may participate in this duel unless summoned via magic. Â The contestants will be summoned to the Duel Arena in 3â¦ 2â¦ 1â¦ For sacrificing your foe, you gain +5 INT. The Demonâs Duel has been concluded. Zayn Darkmore has triumphed over Kali Dorna on the sands of the arena. Kali Dorna shall suffer the following death penalty for her loss: |Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â All undead under the control of Kali Dorna (including Deathsworn Travelers) will be immediately freed from her control, and upon their destruction may return to life as members of their former races. Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â All other property and funds belonging to Kali Dorna are henceforth ceded to Zayn Darkmore. Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Prior to logoff, Kali Dorna must suffer the pain of all the tortures sheâs inflicted on others in this world, condensed into one minuteâs time. Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Afterwards, the character Kali Dorna will be deleted completely, with the loss of all reincarnation bonuses.

fields.title: Chapter 193 - Shudderwall
fields.content: Lady Shyora smiled at me as a pair of succubi wearing a tabard displaying Malcanthetâs symbol (and little else) came into the arena and gathered up the now-defiled daughter of Pelor. Not bothering to give the godling another look, I turned to face the Lilitu. She held up her arms to silence the crowd, and said, âWell done, well done, Lord Darkmore! The Queen of Pleasures is pleased with all you have done here this day! As promised, you and yours shall join the others who have earned the right to visit the Queenâs Retreat in Shudderwall, but while they shall know pleasures and more at the hands of some of the Queenâs devoted servants, you shall enjoy the company of Malcanthet herself for the week you reside within her halls, an honor granted to very few mortals indeed!â   As she spoke, five large flying creatures were brought into the arena, along with the other competitors who had earned the trip, and their attendants, which included my party, of course. Looking at the massive creatures, they appeared to be some kind of demonic manta ray, and yet they clearly could fly with ease through the air. Each creature was the size of an elder dragon and carried a platform with seats upon its back. The platforms and the harnesses for the demon beasts were all lavishly done in crimson and polished steel, and bearing the symbol of Malcanthet upon the forehead of each beast, and upon the back of each chair on the platforms.   Shyora led me to the central of the five creatures, and I climbed up with my pets. The other contestants and their servants split themselves between the other creatures. Looking over to Shyora, I said, âI have never heard of creatures such as these.â   Shyora laughed, and it was a beautiful laugh. One could get lost in the sound of her laughter, if they did not know who and what she was. âAh, this is a Flauvaaxu. Iâm not surprised you havenât seen or heard of them before. They may look impressive, but they are fairly docile creatures, enjoying the winds over the mountains near Shudderwall. Something about Shendilavri sustaines them in a way that no other plane can. They are gentle creatures, and useful for transporting people to the Queenâs Retreat without going through the Labryinth or risking the dragonâs ire, but they are ill suited to life outside this realm.â   I nodded slowly as we rose from the ground with great flaps of the beastsâ âwingsâ. I noticed a tinge of magic in the air as we flew, showing that a shield of air covered the platform we rode on, allowing us to breathe and talk easily enough, even though we were soon speeding along quite fast through the skies of Shendilavri. âAh, I see. And the magic to protect the platforms is well done. Subtle, especially if one didnât know what to look for. But then, I expect no less from what must be the Queenâs carriage, for lack of a better word, when she wishes to transport herself about the layer without the effort of spellwork?â   Shyora smiled, and nodded to me. âAh, yes, when the Queen wishes to be seen, or to convey guests personally to her palace in Rivenheart or the retreat of Shudderwall, the Flauvaaxu are sent out so that her guests may relax and observe the beauty of her lands in comfort as they fly.â   âAnd flying very fast they are, too. It is hard to tell from the waves below, but looking back, the island is quite a ways behind us already.â Indeed, Istancion was already fading into the distance as we flew across the Scarlet Sea, heading into the west. It was receeding at such a pace that I wouldnât be surprised if we were outracing many cars on the highways of the real world.   Shyora giggled, and said, âWell, the route we will fly is almost three hundred miles long, but we will be there in just shy of three hours. Tell me, Lord Darkmore, Chosen of Sharess, do you have any idea of what we might do in those hours while we are flying above the lands of lust and pleasure?â   I smiled at her, and said, âWell, Lady Shyora, Radiant Sister of Malcanthet, why donât you sit upon my lap and I will tell you of what I might find an interesting diversion as we fly through the skies, hmm?â   âHah! I told you he wouldnât wait!â   I ignored the chattering behind me, and the sound of money exchanging hands as bets were won and lost while Shyora climbed into my chair, and we began a long discussion on the proper way of traveling in Shendilavri.   Two hours later, I was quite relaxed, as was Shyora. Oh, we hadnât gone at it the whole time, but a nice, leisurely ride while riding in the sky was quite enjoyable, and left me quite relaxed, as I said, when we passed over Rivenheart, and then turned to the north, passing over a great hedge maze covering at least a hundred miles. At one point as we flew over, I saw a dragon in the sky below, circling the maze and looking down for prey.   Shyora leaned over from her chair, and said, âDonât worry about Gulmengluum. Heâs really a wonderful conversationalist, when you find something to interest him. Heâs taken it upon himself to be the guardian of the Queenâs maze, ensuring that no one cheats by trying to fly or simply blast their way through the hedges or going in as a group. It is said that if someone makes it to the true center, then the Queen will grant them one Wish. Such a boon is not given lightly, and so Gulmengluum ensures that any who seek it do so fairly.â   I spent the next hour considering the enormous hedge maze. This was the Abyss, so it was likely that things were not so simple as just âget to the center of the mazeâ. No, there were likely to be all kinds of traps down there, and monsters as well. And going in alone, while being unable to fly out or cheat? That was an excellent way to find yourself trapped forever within the maze, until you eventually perished. It was, perhaps, a good metaphor for this plane in general. The beauty that was everywhere and the pleasures offered in every corner were merely an enticement, a trap, designed to lure people into shifting their allegiances and giving themselves over to the Demon Queen of the Succubi.   Soon, the mountains in the distance began to come into more detail, with snow-topped peaks that looked no different than those in any part of the material plane, but likely had all sorts of interesting encounters for those who thought mountain climbing was a fun diversion. Upon the slopes of one such mountain, the monotony of grey stone and white snow was broken by the peach-colored stone walls that rose out of the cliffs on a high shelf. High towers and long halls marked the areas within the keep. It looked like a medieval castle, and more like the Neuschwanstein Castle, yet every curve and line seemed sensual in some way, especially the twin towers with their luscious domes, conveying a feeling of warmth, welcome, and lust that went beyond simple architecture. The building was designed and enchanted to make those who saw it long to be there, to be inside its walls.   The other four flauvaaxu lande upon a shelf clearly designed for the purpose, just outside the great gate on the outer wall that separated the palace, for that is what it was, from the outside world. That gate, an upright oval of a darker pink than the surrounding stone, stood open, a rose quartz nearly three feet across (and thus perfectly proportioned for its placement at the top of the arch) glowing brightly as pink light played over those who entered, in what Shyora told me was a magical scan for ill intent against Malcanthet, but I did not doubt was more than just that.   Instead of the landing outside the gates of Shudderwall like the others, we flew low over the keep, passing through the valley between the two towers until we came to a landing at a tall building in the back, where crimson rested against the peach stone, forming a pair of luscious lips when viewed from afar. Above them were two great rounded windows, like eyes, and the black tiled roof looking ever so much like raven hair falling against the mountainside. On a landing by the âlipsâ, the great flying creature came to a rest, and Shyora led us off the platform, so that the flauvaaxu could return to wherever they stayed when they were not waiting upon the Succubus Queenâs whim to carry passengers to and from her lair. As we dismounted, another beauty emerged from a doorway inset in the peach colored walls.   Shyora spoke quickly with the woman, and then turned to us. âI am afraid that I must leave now, as there are things which must be attended to back in Rivenheart, and the Queen has trusted me to handle them. This is Ifrana Shadowmane, the Queenâs personal maid, and the one who truly runs things here in Shudderwall. She will take you to where the Queen is awaiting your presence and pleasure. I hope you will come and see me when you next pass through Rivenheart.â And with a wink, she teleported away in a flash, leaving us with the new woman.   Ifrana ShadowmaneGodtouched Half-Dragon Succubus FemaleLevel 200 Chaos Sorceress (Flame Sorceress) / Chaos Fist (Monk)Titles: Magick Seeker, Genius, Polyglot, Dark Ritualist, Divine Ritualist, Drunken Fist Initiate, Serpent Style Initiate, Midnight Aesthetician, Sadist, Masochist, Sexecutioner, Chief Maid of Shudderwall Godtouched Half-Dragon Succubus Female Titles: Magick Seeker, Genius, Polyglot, Dark Ritualist, Divine Ritualist, Drunken Fist Initiate, Serpent Style Initiate, Midnight Aesthetician, Sadist, Masochist, Sexecutioner, Chief Maid of Shudderwall   As the maid looked us over, I took a moment to observe her. She had quite the impressive collection of titles, and a couple advanced classes I had not heard of before. Perhaps they were demon-exclusives? At any rate, it was clear that whoever had chosen the âuniformâ for the chief maid had a very lustful eye, and knew best how to emphasize her assets. Picture the sluttiest âFrench maidâ costume youâve ever seen, and then remove 10% more fabric from it. And yet I could see from the aura that the clothes were not mere fabric, but actually provided some serious protection, as good as any high-level cloth armor would have a right to expect. It was carefully tailored to hide what needed to be hidden, though keeping it always on the edge of accessibility, while offering her freedom of movement and the magical protection enhancing her defensese more than a suit of plate armor might. Even the feather duster she carried in one hand was heavily enchanted, to the point I did not doubt that it was more than just a simple duster.   When she spoke, it was not in a way that would convey âlustâ or âsexy maid available for your pleasureâ, but more the cool, ice queen of the library kind of tone. âWelcome, honored guests, to Shudderwall. The Gates will close momentarily, and will remain magically sealed for seven days once they have been shut unless the Queen herself commands them to open. While you are here, all manner of pleasures will be available to you. Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the law. However, you are not allowed to interfere with the Queenâs servants who are performing her will.â She pointed out a silk band on her right arm that had the symbol of Malcanthet upon it. âAny servant wearing a band with the Queenâs symbol on it like this one is on the Queenâs business, and is not to be touched until they have completed their task and taken off the band. At any other point, day or night, anywhere within the palace, anyone you see here is free for use by anyone, save those who are slaves, and then they must abide by their Masterâs will. Attempting to use a slave belonging to another against their Masterâs will shall be considered a grave offense. The last fool to test these rules was thrown naked through a portal to Thanatos, the plane ruled by Orcus, Demon Prince of the Undead, for the roaving bands of the undead to devour. Do you understand these rules that I have just stated to you?â   When we all nodded, she smiled, more warmly this time, and said, âExcellent. Then if you will follow me, the Queen awaits.â

fields.title: Chapter 18 - Guild Card and Second Night
